info.description: Meisterplan is a portfolio-level resource management tool that helps portfolio and resource managers manage people across teams and initiatives whether your work is traditional, agile or hybrid. Use it to make confident portfolio decisions and interactively surface and solve resource conflicts.
info.title: Meisterplan

tags.name: OBS
tags.description: Operations on OBS types and OBS units. Each OBS or OBS type can have any number of OBS units, for example, the OBS Department could have Marketing and Software Engineering as OBS units.

tags.name: Role Capacities
tags.description: Operations on Role Capacity. A role's own capacity is inherent to the role, and does not contain the capacities of resources assigned to this role.

tags.name: SCIM 2.0 (Premium)
tags.description: Operations on users and user groups. A Premium Edition is required to use these operations. You can use these operations to implement automatic user provisioning.

tags.name: Users (Premium)
tags.description: Operations on users. A Premium Edition is required to use these operations. If you would like to implement automatic user provisioning, please refer to the SCIM 2.0 endpoints.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks allow to subscribe to notifications about changes in Meisterplan. An HTTP request with a small payload is sent to the specified endpoint when an event that you have subscribed to occurs. Currently webhooks support the following types of events: Project Created, Project Updated, Project Deleted.

get.description: Returns all business goals
Get a list of all calendars in your Meisterplan system.

post.description: Create a calendar with the given data. Will return the newly created calendar.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Calendar represented by a JSON document.

post.description: Sets an existing calendar as the default calendar in your Meisterplan system.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The id of an existing calendar.

get.description: Get one calendar in your Meisterplan system. Use the special ID defaultCalendar to get the default calendar.

delete.description: Deletes a calendar in your Meisterplan system. Please note that the default calendar or a parent of the default calendar cannot be deleted.

patch.description:
Perform an update on a calendar specified by the given ID.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Calendar represented by a JSON document.

get.summary: Get a List of Calendar Exceptions
get.description: Get a list of all exceptions to this calendar in your Meisterplan system.

post.description:
Use this request to replace all calendar exceptions for a certain time period. This time period can be defined using the root start and finish attributes of the request. Specify the new list of calendar exceptions with the exceptions property. Note that all exceptions in the specified period will be overwritten by the exceptions listed in the exceptions property.

-   If null is used for the start period and end period, all exceptions     of the calendar are overwritten -   If only the start date of the period is defined, all exceptions     starting from this time will be overwritten -   If only the end date of the period is defined, all exceptions up to     that point will be overwritten -   If an exception is removed and a parent calendar has an exception at     that date, this calendar inherits the exception from the parent     calendar.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Calendar exceptions of a given time period represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns information about the connected user.
Returns swagger schema for webhook notifications.

parameters.description: OBS Unit represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns a list of all available portfolios. If you do not have the right to view any portfolio, Returns a list of all available portfolios that you have the right to access via your API token. If you do not have the right to view any portfolio, an empty list will be returned.
This endpoint is paginated. It returns a list of resources up to the specified PAGESIZE

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Stringified JSON object with a subset of properties of the expected object. Selects all objects that exactly match the specified properties. Note: take care to URL encode your parameter. { "resourceKey": string, "lastName": string, "externalId": string, "emailAddress": string, "postalAddress": { "city": string, "country": string, "postalCode": string } }

parameters.name: pageAfter
parameters.description: The cursor after which to retrieve results. The cursor can be taken from a preceding request.

post.description:
Creates a resource by the given fields and returns the newly created.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Resource represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns the individual resource specified by the given ID.

delete.description: Delete the resource specified by the given ID. If the resource with the given ID does not exist, the request fails.

patch.description:
Perform an update on a resource specified by the given ID.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Resource represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns a list of absences of the resource.

parameters.name: finishDate
parameters.description: Inclusive finish date for filtering time period.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date for filtering time period

post.description: Use this request to add an absence for a certain time period. This time period can be defined using the start and finish attributes of the request.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Absence in a given time period represented by a JSON document.

put.description: This endpoint lets you replace all absences of a resource. The result will be the same as if all existing absences are deleted and the passed absences are created again.

parameters.name: absences
parameters.description: Absences represented by a JSON document.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Inclusive end date of replacement period.

get.description: Returns the individual absence specified by the given ID.

patch.description: Use this request to update an absence.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Absence in a given time period represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Reads deviations to the resource's calendar working hours. If no start and finish values are passed, all deviations of the requested resource are returned. If only start is passed, all deviations starting from this time are returned. If only finish is passed, all deviations up to that point are returned.

parameters.name: finish
parameters.description: Finish date for filtering time period

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date for filtering time period

post.description:
Use this request to replace all calendar deviations of a resource for a certain time period. This time period can be defined using the root start and finish attributes of the request. Specify the new list of calendar deviations with the deviations property. Note that all deviations in the specified period will be overwritten by the deviations listed in the deviations property.

-   If null is used for the start period and end period, all calendar     deviations of the resource are overwritten -   If only the start date of the period is defined, all deviations     starting from this time will be overwritten -   If only the end date of the period is defined, all deviations up to     that point will be overwritten -   If null is used for the start and/or end date of a calendar     deviation, the deviation is assumed to last from or until the root     start or finish date specified above.

All deviations are flattened into a sequential structure. Cases of overlapping deviations will be resolved by giving precedence to deviations occurring later in the array.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Calendar deviations of a given time period represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns a list of all available roles. If no roles are available, an empty list is returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Stringified JSON object with a subset of properties of the expected object. Selects all objects that exactly match the specified properties. Note: take care to URL encode your parameter. { "externalId": string, "name": string }

post.description:
Returns the created role on success.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Role represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns the individual role specified by the given ID.

delete.description: Delete the role specified by the given ID. If the role with the given ID does not exist, the request will fail.

patch.description:
Perform an update on a role specified by the given ID. To do a partial update, only the updated fields need to be sent. To delete a field value, the field must be sent with an explicit null value. Fields with a default value will be reset to their default when set to null.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Role represented by a JSON document.

get.description: It returns a list of scenarios
Returns the individual scenario specified by the given ID. HINT: You can use "planOfRecord" as the ID for the plan of record scenario.

get.summary: Get a List of Milestone Dependencies
get.description: Returns a list of milestones dependencies of a scenario

parameters.name: pageAfter
parameters.description: The cursor after which to retrieve results. The cursor can be taken from a preceding request.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Milestone dependency represented by a JSON document.

delete.description: Deletes a milestone dependency in a given scenario.

post.description: This endpoint updates the priorities of projects and programs. Please consider that updating the priority of a project that is within a program results in unassigning the project from its program.To update the priorities of your projects and programs, list their IDs in the desired order of priority for each rank category. If there are projects or programs in Meisterplan for a particular rank category that are not mentioned in your list, you can use the position parameter to define whether your listed projects and programs will be ranked above or below those in Meisterplan.

parameters.name: prioritiesUpdateRequest
parameters.description: Priorities represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns a list of programs in the given scenario

post.description: Creates a program with the given fields and returns the newly created program.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Program represented by a JSON document.

delete.description: Deletes a program specified by the given ID.

patch.description: Perform an update on a program specified by the given ID.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Program represented by a JSON document.

get.description: This endpoint is paginated. It returns a list of projects up to the specified PAGESIZE

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Stringified JSON object with a subset of properties of the expected object. Selects all objects that exactly match the specified properties. Projects are searchable by projectKey, name, externalId, programId, portfolioId, status and custom fields. Lookup fields can be filtered by a list of String values (logically OR link). Filtering on custom Currency, Date or Decimal fields is currently not supported. The filter programId = null will yield all projects that are not associated with a program. Furthermore, the filter portfolioId = null will yield all projects. Note: take care to URL encode your parameter. { "projectKey": string, "name": string, "externalId": string, "programId": string, "portfolioId": string, "status": [string, string, ...], "customFields": { "cust_string_field_1": string, "cust_lookup_field_2": [string, string, ...], "cust_boolean_field_3": true, "cust_integer_field_4": integer, .... } }

parameters.name: pageAfter
parameters.description: The cursor after which to retrieve results. The cursor can be taken from a preceding request.

post.description: Creates a project with the given fields and returns the newly created project.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Project represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns the individual project specified by the given ID.

delete.description: Deletes a project in a given scenario.

patch.description: Perform an update on a project specified by the given ID.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Project represented by a JSON document.

get.summary: Get a List of Actual Time Worked
get.description: Returns a list of actual time worked for all projects of a specific scenario. Please note that actual time worked data itself is independent from its scenario.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Stringified JSON object with an entity id and that entity's type. The type can be "RESOURCE" or "ROLE". Selects all objects that exactly match the specified properties. Note: take care to URL encode your parameter. { "id": string, "type": string }

parameters.name: pageAfter
parameters.description: The cursor after which to retrieve results. The cursor can be taken from a preceding request.

post.summary: Create or Update Actual Time Worked
post.description: This endpoint lets you create new Actual Time Worked and update the existing Actual Time Worked of a project by an entity (resource or role). We will not update Actual Time Worked for booking dates that are not specified in the request for a given project and entity. With the mode property you can control if an existing Actual Time Worked value is replaced by the new value or if its value is added to the booking in the request.Please note that actual time worked data itself is independent from its scenario. It will be the same across all scenarios for a given project.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Actual Time Worked represented by a JSON document.

delete.description: Deletes all actual time worked of a given project.

get.description: Returns a list of allocations of a project

post.description: This endpoint lets you create new allocations and update existing allocations of a project. Changes will only be made for the specified date ranges as well as the specified resources and roles.

parameters.name: allocationCreateOrUpdateRequest
parameters.description: Allocation represented by a JSON document.

put.description: This endpoint lets you replace all allocations of a project. The result will be the same as if all existing allocations are deleted and the passed allocations are created again.

parameters.name: allocationReplaceRequest
parameters.description: Allocation represented by a JSON document.

get.description: Returns the individual allocation specified by the given ID.

delete.description: Deletes an allocation in a given project of a scenario.

patch.description: This endpoint lets you update existing allocations of a project. Changes will only be made for the specified date ranges as well as the specified resources and roles.

parameters.name: allocationUpdateRequest
parameters.description: Allocation represented by a JSON document.

get.summary: Get the capacity segments of all roles
get.description: Returns the capacity segments for all roles. If no capacity segments exist for a given role, its role capacities will be empty.

get.description: Returns the capacity segments for the role specified by the given ID. Returns an empty list if no capacity segments exist.

post.summary: Update the capacity segments of a role
post.description: Updates the capacity segments for the role specified by the given ID. To erase all capacity segments, send a segment without start or finish and 0 capacity

bookings.description: Booking date and hours of this actual time worked entry

bookingDate.description: Booking date of this actual time worked entry

id.description: The id of the entity to which this actual time worked entry is linked

type.description: The entity type for this actual time worked entry

rank.description: Rank depends on the date range and portfolio filter.

id.description: The id of the entity to which this allocation is linked. Set type to RESOLVE_BY_KEY_OR_NAME to resolve resource keys or role names automatically instead.

projectRole.description: The role id to which this allocation is linked. This field is only valid in combination with the types RESOURCE or RESOLVE_BY_KEY_OR_NAME. If type is set to RESOLVE_BY_KEY_OR_NAME, projectRole is resolved by name.

type.description: Control how the value in the field id is interpreted. RESOURCE resolves resources by UUID. ROLE resolves roles by UUID. RESOLVE_BY_KEY_OR_NAME resolves either resources by resource key or roles by role name.

id.description: The id of the entity to which this allocation is linked

projectRole.description: Will only be set if type equals RESOURCE

type.description: The entity type for this allocation

days.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

fte.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

hours.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

days.description: The request accepts either hours or days.

hours.description: The request accepts either hours or days.

value.description: Value represents the ID of a user.

id.description: The id of the entity to which this actual time worked entry is linked. Set type to RESOLVE_BY_KEY_OR_NAME to resolve resource keys or role names automatically instead.

costPerHour.description: Cost per hour for this booking

name.description:
Missing values will be created automatically

If you import an unknown value, it will be automatically created for you in Meisterplan.

id.description: default: uses default calendar if path and id are null. If you specify the id to reference a calendar you must omit the path property.

path.description: default: uses default calendar if path and id are null. format: See endpoint description. If you specify the path to reference a calendar you must omit the id property.

days.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

fte.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

hours.description: The request accepts either FTE, hours or days.

name.description: The financials category must exist prior to creation. It will not be implicitly created.

value.description: Value may be of type string, number, boolean, or null depending on the custom field definition and its current value.

CustomFieldValueType.title: CustomFieldValueType
CustomFieldValueType.description:
Missing lookup values created automatically

If you create or update a project with a custom lookup field, unknown lookup values will be automatically created.

milestoneId.description: Only present when timing type equals Milestone

resourceKey.description: Resource key of the linked resource.

id.description: If you specify the id to reference a project manager you must omit the resourceKey property.

resourceKey.description: If you specify the resourceKey to reference a project manager you must omit the id property.

id.description: If you specify the id to reference an OBS unit you must omit the path property.

path.description:
Missing OBS paths will be created implicitly

If you send an OBS path, all necessary path segments will be created for you in Meisterplan automatically.

Paths

Paths delimited by / (e.g. in calendars and OBS unit paths) may define path segments which contain / by escaping with //. E.g. the path Europe/Berlin//Amsterdam will be interpreted as ['Europe', 'Berlin/Amsterdam']. An uneven amount of slashes will be interpreted as the following segment starting with one or more slashes.

displayName.description: The display name is rendered the same way as it is in the Meisterplan application's user interface
The display name is rendered the same way as it is in the Meisterplan application's user interface

position.description: Position can be FIRST or LAST. FIRST is default

id.description: The id value can be a project or a program.

externalId.description: Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

projectKey.description: Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

name.description: The project phase must exist prior to creation. It will not be implicitly created.

projectKey.description: Must be unique and must not be empty.

externalId.description: Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

resourceKey.description: Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

skills.description:
Missing values will be created automatically

If you import an unknown value, it will be automatically created for you in Meisterplan.

id.description: If you specify the id to reference a resource manager you must omit the resourceKey property.

resourceKey.description: If you specify the resourceKey to reference a resource manager you must omit the id property.
Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

finish.description: End date of this role capacity segment. Optional.

start.description: Start date of this role capacity segment. Optional.

segments.description: Role capacity segments to update for this role.

externalId.description: Must be unique. If empty, value will be generated.

value.description: Value represents the ID of a group.

userName.description: Must be unique and must not be blank.

ScimLinkedResourceRequest.title: ScimLinkedResourceRequest
ScimLinkedResourceRequest.description: A resource can be linked via id or via resourceKey. Only one of these may be present.

resourceKey.description: Resource key of the linked resource.

op.description: Not all fields support every type of operation. An invalid operation will return a BAD REQUEST (400).

userName.description: Must be unique and must not be blank.

primary.description: Meisterplan supports only one E-Mail address per user. This field must be true.

type.description: Meisterplan supports only one E-Mail address per user. The type must be 'work'.

value.description: The E-Mail address of the user. A user requires an E-Mail address.

primary.description: Meisterplan supports only one E-Mail address per user. This field is always true.

type.description: Meisterplan supports only one E-Mail address per user. The type is always 'work'.

value.description: The value represents the E-Mail address of the user.

resourceType.description: Resource Type for users is always 'user'.

formatted.description: The formatted name is a combination of the user's family name and given name.

value.description: ID of the user. Must not be blank.

Missing values will be created automatically

If you import an unknown value, it will be automatically created for you in Meisterplan.
If you have no permission to this field, the value is null.

dueDate.description: Is only valid in combination with on: Date (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

milestoneId.description: Is only valid in combination with on: Milestone. The milestone must exist in the project. It will not be implicitly created.

on.description: Milestone is only valid in combination with a value in the field milestoneId. Date is only valid in combination with a value in the field dueDate.

callbackUrl.description: Has to be a valid https URL.

eventTypes.description: At least one event type needs to be provided.

name.description: If not set the callback URL is also used for the name.

projectId.description: The projectId is optional. It is only required if you want to subscribe to a specific project.

scenarioId.description: The scenario you want to subscribe to.

secret.description: The secret is optional. It is used to create a HmacSHA256 signature of the notification payload that is sent to the callback URL.

status.description: The new status of the webhook.
